results.title: Having a say
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: The English in the Workplace Scheme is designed to help non-English speaking unionists to take their place in Australian society. This program outlines the problems and the responses to the scheme.

results.title: Having a go: a look at small business in Australia
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce, Tony Coyte and Richard Cassidy
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with entrepreneurs from five successful small Australian businesses. Each provides advice on how to succeed while stressing the need to be fully informed and equipped with proper business skills. Highlights the importance of government sponsored small business agencies for providing information and training.
results.title_for_label: Having a go: a look at small business in Australia
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce, Tony Coyte and Richard Cassidy

results.title: Haven of peace
results.creator_credit: African Film Productions and Department of Social Development (Dar-es-Salaam)
results.brief_description: Considers the place of Dar-es-Salam in the development of a large multi-racial community. The port is represented as a colorful mixture of the old and the new, its traditional life and culture existing side by side with modern health, education and social services, housing schemes, and improvements in trade and communications.

results.title: Have You Ever Thought?
results.creator_credit: Christian Myles Productions and Doreen Bentley
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the lives and the work of the Pastorelle Sisters, an order of Nuns in Thornbury, Melbourne. Their lives are centred around the person and teaching of Jesus, lived out in small communities, deeply concerned about the life of people, and working with clergy and laity in the building up of Christian communities.

results.title: Have our planet and eat it too
results.brief_description: Shows controversy between a company in favour of open-pit mining on national forest land, and a community that opposes this land usage. Deals with the concern over changes in water, air, wildlife and vegetation, and the conflict between old mining laws, and the National Environmental Policy Act.

results.title: Have I told you lately that I love you? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A symbolic record of one day in the life of the members of an upper-middle-class American family, showing their dependence upon machines and the effect of automation on their relationships with one another.

results.title: Have I ever lied to you before?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low and John Spotton
results.brief_description: Advertising and Jerry Goodis are an inseparable combination. This fascinating documentary takes a behind-the-scenes looks at the power plays in the advertising business in Canada. It explores the conflict and the difficulties faced on the production of one particular commercial which Goodis does not like, yet has to sell. Includes a ‘Hush Puppies’ commercial showing people talking to their feet. Photographed by Douglas Kiefer.

results.title: Have a heart
results.creator_credit: Tantalus Films, Saul Rubin, Ken Plotin and Kaye Dyal
results.brief_description: Describes the function of the heart and circulatory system and emphasises the need for a healthy lifestyle to prevent heart disease. A heart attack victim is shown being given electric shock treatment. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Have a healthy baby: pregnancy. - Rev. ed. (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Spencer Peel and Jane Treiman
results.brief_description: Follows the process of pregnancy, explaining how a baby develops, what a mother experiences, and what prenatal care is necessary to ensure a healthy baby. Animation details the important stages of growth of the human embryo from conception through pregnancy. Stresses the complexity of the process and the role nutrition, exercise and good health habits play.

results.title: Have a healthy baby
results.brief_description: Using animation, the film details the important stages of growth of the human embryo from conception to birth. There is major emphasis on the precise development of organ systems during the first three months. Ways that development may be disturbed, and the role played by good nutrition and health habits are also stressed.
